headline.main: Along With the Bible, a Poetry Anthology; The Vision of 2 Unlikely Collaborators Places Books of Verse in the Hands of Travelers

results.snippet: In the musty confines of hotel- and motel-room night stands, where one book has long reigned supreme, the word of God is getting a run for the money these days from the words of Emily Dickinson, Walt Whitman and Robert Frost.   Over the last year...
results.lead_paragraph: In the musty confines of hotel- and motel-room night stands, where one book has long reigned supreme, the word of God is getting a run for the money these days from the words of Emily Dickinson, Walt Whitman and Robert Frost. Over the last year thousands of anthologies have turned up, like mints on the pillow, in hotels and motels around the country as part of an attempt to do for American poetry what the Gideons have done for the Bible.
